content.question:
Which of the following is the expression for the equilibrium constant, <math alttext="K sub c" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="italic">c</mi></msub></math>, for the reaction represented by the balanced chemical equation shown?

<math alttext="2 N O, gas, plus B r 2, gas, is in equilibrium with 2 N O B r, gas" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>NO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>â‡„</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>NOBr</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub c equals the fraction with numerator the molar concentration of N O, times, the molar concentration of B r 2, and denominator the molar concentration of N O B r" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>c</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mpadded><mrow><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NO</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mrow><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></mpadded><mpadded><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NOBr</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></mfrac></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="K sub c equals the fraction with numerator the molar concentration of N O B r, and denominator the molar concentration of N O, times, the molar concentration of B r 2, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>c</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NOBr</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mrow><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NO</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></mrow></mfrac></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="K sub c equals the fraction with numerator the molar concentration of N O, squared, times, the molar concentration of B r 2, and denominator the molar concentration of N O B r, squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>c</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NO</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></mrow><msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NOBr</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="K sub c equals the fraction with numerator the molar concentration of N O B r, squared, and denominator the molar concentration of N O, squared, times, the molar concentration of B r 2, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>c</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NOBr</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NO</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub c equals the fraction with numerator the molar concentration of N O B r, squared, and denominator the molar concentration of N O, squared, times, the molar concentration of B r 2, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>c</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NOBr</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NO</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
